title: Marvel - Messiah War (2009) [antiotaku] [h33t]
description:
Messiah War
---------------------------
Cable and X-Force crossover

-This is my submission to be added to the Marvel
Major Event Chronology in spot 59.
-Files were renamed for order, but the scan credits
remain in tact in the files. Props to DCP,
Minutemen, and all the scanners and editors. You
guys keep the scene alive, love your work.
-This is my first comic upload. I believe in the
"if you have it, share it," philosophy. Hopefully I
can afford a seedbox and separate line to upload.
My goal is to make large, organized torrents out of the comics I have downloaded and keep the scene
alive.

       ~AntiOtaku~


Summary
----------------------------
Messiah War is a crossover storyline running through the issues of Cable and X-Force with cover dates of May through July 2009 as well as a one-shot titled X-Force/Cable: Messiah War published by Marvel Comics. Writer Craig Kyle describes it as being the follow up to Messiah Complex and "the middle chapter of what I think will be a major three-part saga, which will continue to define and redefine the X-Universe moving forward". (stolen from Wikipedia)

Cable has leapt into the timestream with the first baby born since M-Day, the hope of keeping the mutant race alive. The only problem is that the former X-Man Lucas Bishop decides that the baby is the first step towards the end of mutantkind and must be killed. After savagely beating Forge, he steals a cybernetic arm to replace his missing limb and every device, note, and scrap that Forge had collected on time travel and jumped into the timestream after Cable and the baby. This story follows Cable trying to raise a child in a less-than-utopian society while constantly having to look over his shoulder to protect her.


Listing and Order
-----------------------------
1. X-Force / Cable - Messiah War One-Shot
2. Cable 13
3. X-Force 14
4. Cable 14
5. X-Force 15
6. Cable 15
7. X-Force 16

Thanks
-----------------------------
Thanks to everyone who keeps the scene alive.
Especially a large thanks to both gilgamesh07 and
PeterThePIPster for their weekly/daily
contributions of the Marvel Chronology and the new
weekly comics. Without these guys I'd have more
holes than a dead hooker.
